facts.1: Marks the independence of Niger from France on August 3rd, 1960.
facts.2: It is a national holiday in Niger, celebrated with parades, cultural events, and fireworks.
facts.3: The holiday emphasizes national unity and freedom, being a symbol of pride for the citizens of Niger.

facts.1: This feast is celebrated in honor of the Divine Savior of the World, patron saint of El Salvador's capital.
facts.2: Celebrations include religious ceremonies, street fairs, and traditional folklore dances.
facts.3: One of the most significant events is the 'Bajada,' a reenactment of the Transfiguration of Jesus.

facts.1: National Watermelon Day is an unofficial holiday in the United States dedicated to appreciating watermelon.
facts.2: Watermelon Day is celebrated with watermelon-themed events, competitions, and festivals.
facts.3: Watermelons are 92% water, making them a popular summer snack particularly on this day for their refreshing quality.
